isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION CARRIERS: ROCKWELL - DRIVER CONTROLLED MAIN DIFFERENTIAL LOCK - INSTALL DIFFERENTIAL SHIFT ASSEMBLY

svcprocinfo.para: Install the differential shift assembly after the differential carrier is assembled and the gear and bearing adjustments are made. Parts of the shift assembly are shown in Figure 138.

calloutgroup.callout1: 11. FLAT WASHER OR SILASTIC AS REQUIRED

step1.para: Install the two roll pins into the ends of the shift fork. Tap the pins into position until they are level with the inner yoke face ( Figure 139). Do not install completely at this time.

figure.caption: Figure 139. Tap Roll Pins into Position

step1.para: If the spring stop roll pin was removed from the head of the shift shaft, install the pin at this time.
Apply Loctite 222 to the threads of the shift shaft.
Install the shift fork into its correct position in the carrier case ( Figure 140).

figure.caption: Figure 140. Install Shift Fork in Carrier Case

step1.para: Hold the shift fork in position and install the shift shaft spring into the shift shaft opening in the carrier, through the shift fork bore and into the bore for the shift shaft spring ( Figure 141).
Slide the shift shaft over the spring and install the shaft into the shift fork. Tighten to 20 to 25 ft-lbs. (27 to 34 N·m).
Install the flat washer (when used) or apply silastic sealant to the bottom of the cylinder bore ( Figure 142).

figure.caption: Figure 142. Install Flat Washer or Apply Silastic Sealant to Bottom of Cylinder Bore

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. INSTALL FLAT WASHER OR APPLY SILASTIC SEALANT

step1.para: Install the O-ring into its groove on the piston. Lubricate the O-ring with axle lubricant. Install the piston into the air cylinder ( Figure 142).
Install the cylinder into the housing bore. Make sure that the pilot journal on the piston is against its bore on the shift shaft ( Figure 143).

figure.caption: Figure 143. Install Cylinder into Housing Bore

step1.para: Install the copper gasket into its bore on the inside of the cylinder cover. Put the cover in position over the cylinder so that the air intake port will point up when the carrier is installed into the housing. Install the cover with the four attaching cap- screws and washers. Tighten to 7.4 to 8.9 ft-lbs. (10 to 12 N·m) ( Figure 144).

Slide the shift collar into the fork and engage the shift collar splines with the splines of the differential case. Use the manual actuation capscrew to move the shift collar splines into the differential case splines. Refer to INSTALL CARRIER INTO AXLE HOUSING, Manual Engaging Method.
Hold the shift collar in the locked (engaged) position and tap in the two roll pins in the shift fork ends until they are level with the outer yoke faces ( Figure 145).

figure.caption: Figure 145. Tap in Roll Pins in Shift Fork Ends

step1.para: While the shift collar is still in the locked position, put the sensor switch (with the lock nut loosely attached) into its hole.

Connect a battery/bulb tester to the sensor switch and rotate the switch into its hole until contact with the shift fork causes the light to go on. Turn the switch one additional revolution and tighten the lock nut to 26 to 33 ft-lbs. (35 to 45 N·m).

svcsubproc.title: Carriers Without the Differential Lock (Less Air Shift)
svcsubproc.para: Assemble the sensor switch plug and cover plate as follows:

step1.para: Install the washer and plug into the hole for the sensor switch. Tighten the plug to 45 to 55 ft-lbs. (60 to 74 N·m) ( Figure 146).
Apply silicone gasket material to the cover plate mounting surface on the carrier. Refer to APPLICATION OF SILICONE GASKET MATERIAL.
Install the four washers and capscrews. Tighten the capscrews to 7.4 to 8.9 ft- lbs. (10 to 12 N·m) ( Figure 146).

note.para: When the carrier is to be installed into the axle housing, the shift collar must be held in the engaged position. This can be done by keeping the air pressure applied to the shift cylinder (refer to INSTALL CARRIER INTO AXLE HOUSING, Air Pressure Method), or by using the manual engaging bolt (refer to INSTALL CARRIER INTO AXLE HOUSING, Manual Engaging Method). Failure to keep the differential in the locked (engaged) position will make it impossible to install the carrier assembly into the axle housing.

svcsubproc.para: After the carrier is installed into the axle housing, shift the differential into the unlocked (disengaged) position to permit the installation of the right hand axle shaft.
